name: 葛瑞斐
objective: Through weekly readings and class discussion, this course will help develop students’ English conversation and reading skills.  In the course of practicing such skills, we will take as our general topic the theme of good and evil, in particular the importance of these two concepts to an understanding of the role of the hero in American culture.  Examining essays and films about the nature of good and evil, heroes and villains, we will consider why the vocabulary of the hero and the heroic is so widespread in American politics and popular culture, and what the rhetoric of good and evil tells us about Western society and its people.
